text:
When javac is run with fork="true" and there are many sources files, a file listing all of the sources is written to java.io.tmpdir. This file is supplied as an argument to javac.

If there isn't enough space in java.io.tmpdir to write the file no error is reported. If only part of the file can be written, only files listed in the partial file are compiled.

javac should throw an exception if it's not able to write the full list of sources to java.io.tmpdir.
creator: david_donn@pacific.net.au
